table.description: Detailed information about a single CLU.
table.name: KSLU_CLU

column.description: Unique identifier for a Canonical Learning Unit (CLU). This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the CLU has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description:
The organization responsible for accrediting the program.
Replaced by accreditationList
column.name: ACCRED_ORG_ID

column.description: The primary organization (typically, an academic department) with administrative oversight over the CLU.
column.name: ADMIN_ORG_ID

column.description: Default enrollment estimate for this CLU.
column.name: DEF_ENRL_EST

column.description: Default maximum enrollment for this CLU.
column.name: DEF_MAX_ENRL

column.description: Date and time the CLU became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this CLU expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: When the next review should be
column.name: NEXT_REVIEW_PRD

column.description: An URL for additional information about the CLU. This could be a reference to a document which might in turn have references to other documents (e.g. course syllabus provided by the faculty or department, standard schedule of classes, etc.).
column.name: REF_URL

column.description: The current status of the clu. The values for this field are constrained to those in the luState enumeration. A separate setup operation does not exist for retrieval of the meta data around this value. This field may not be updated through updating this structure and must instead be updated through a dedicated operation.
column.name: ST

column.description: The Study Subject Area is used to identify the area of study associated with the clu. It may be a general study area (e.g. Chemistry) or very specific (e.g. Naval Architecture) depending on the level of specificity of the clu.
column.name: STDY_SUBJ_AREA

column.description: Narrative description of the CLU, used for the catalog.
column.name: RT_DESCR_ID

column.description: A publishable description of the LU to be used for advertising or marketing purposes
column.name: RT_MKTG_DESCR_ID

column.description: Information related to the official identification of the clu, typically in human readable form. Used to officially reference or publish.
column.name: OFFIC_CLU_ID

column.description: Primary potential instructor for the clu. This is primarily for use in advertising the clu and may not be the actual instructor.
column.name: PRI_INSTR_ID

table.description: Detailed information about a CLU to CLU relationship.
table.name: KSLU_CLUCLU_RELTN

column.description: Unique identifier for a CLU to CLU relationship. This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the relation has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description: Date and time that this CLU to CLU relationship became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this CLU to CLU relationship expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: Identifier for the current status of a CLU to CLU relationship. The values for this field are constrained to those in the luLuRelationState enumeration. A separate setup operation does not exist for retrieval of the meta data around this value.
column.name: ST

table.description: Detailed information about accounting for a clu.
table.name: KSLU_CLU_ACCT

table.description: Detailed information about credit for a CLU, including common data-driven constraints around repetition.
table.name: KSLU_CLU_CR

column.description: The total credit hours for use in evaluating the Instructor, meant to cover the concept of Contact Hours
column.name: INSTR_UNIT

column.description: The maximum total number of credits or units earned by the Student. This field will be used for calculations. If specified, should be greater than or equal to the minTotalUnits.
column.name: MAX_TOT_UNIT

column.description: The minimum total number of credits or units earned by the Student. This field will be used for calculations. If specified, should be less than or equal to the maxTotalUnits.
column.name: MIN_TOT_UNIT

column.description: The number of times a student may repeat the course for credit. The values of this field are restricted to integer values and the string unbounded.
column.name: REPEAT_CNT

column.description: The total number of units for which the student may repeat this course.
column.name: REPEAT_UNIT

table.description: Detailed information associated with this CLU related to the calculation of fees.
table.name: KSLU_CLU_FEE

table.description: Detailed information about the human readable form of a CLU Identifier
table.name: KSLU_CLU_IDENT

column.description: Identifies the particular identifier structure. This is set by the service to be able to determine changes and alterations to the structure as well as provides a handle for searches. This structure is not accessible through unique operations, and it is strongly recommended that no external references to this particular identifier be maintained.
column.name: ID

column.description: The composite string that is used to officially reference or publish the CLU. Note it may have an internal structure that each Institution may want to enforce. This structure may be composed from the other parts of the structure such as Level amp; Division, but may include items such as cluType.
column.name: CD

column.description: A code that indicates what school, program, major, subject area, etc. Examples: Chem, 18
column.name: DIV

column.description: A code that indicates whether this is introductory, advanced, etc.
column.name: LVL

column.description: Abbreviated name of the CLU, commonly used on transcripts
column.name: SHRT_NAME

column.description: Identifies the state of the identifier. Values for this field are constrained to values present within the cluIdentifierState enumeration.
column.name: ST

column.description: Identifies the type of usage for the identifier. While most usages will have the same data constraints, this may provide some context around what the specific intent is for this identifier. (Ex. Why does this alternate identifier exist?)
column.name: TYPE

column.description: A number that indicates the sequence or order of versions in cases where several different Clus have the same offical Identifier
column.name: VARTN

table.description: Information about a potential instructor for a clu.
table.name: KSLU_CLU_INSTR

column.description: Unique identifier for an organization. This indicates which organization this individual is associated with for the purposes of this clu.
column.name: ORG_ID

column.description: Unique identifier for a person record.
column.name: PERS_ID

table.description: Detailed information about publishing a clu.
table.name: KSLU_CLU_PUBL

column.description: Identifier for the publishing information. This is set by the service to be able to determine changes and alterations to the structure as well as provides a handle for searches. This structure is not currently accessible through unique operations, and it is strongly recommended that no external references to this particular identifier be maintained.
column.name: ID

column.description: The end academic time period for when the CLU should be published in this type of usage. If specified, should be greater than or equal to startCycle.
column.name: END_CYCLE

column.description: The start academic time period for when the CLU should be published in this type of usage. Should be less than or equal to endCycle.
column.name: START_CYCLE

column.description: Current state of the information for this publication type. This value should be constrained to those within the cluPublishingState enumeration. In general, an active record for a type indicates that the clu should be published within that media, though that may be further constrained by the cycle information included.
column.name: ST

column.description: Type of publication for which this information should be used. This type should correspond more with usage than media.
column.name: TYPE

column.description: Primary potential instructor for the clu for the purpose of this publication.
column.name: PRI_INSTR_ID

table.description: Detailed information about a single CLU Set.
table.name: KSLU_CLU_SET

column.description: Unique identifier for a CLU Set. This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the CLU Set has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description: Date and time that this CLU Set became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this CLU Set expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: Friendly name of the CLU Set.
column.name: NAME

column.description: Narrative description of the CLU Set.
column.name: RT_DESCR_ID

table.description: Detailed information about a learning objective
table.name: KSLU_LO

column.description: Unique identifier for a learning objective record. This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the learning objective has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description: Date and time that this learning objective became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this learning objective expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: Friendly name of the learning objective
column.name: NAME

column.description: The current status of the learning objective. The values for this field are constrained to those in the loState enumeration. A separate setup operation does not exist for retrieval of the meta data around this value.
column.name: ST

column.description: Narrative description of the learning objective
column.name: RT_DESCR_ID

column.description: Unique identifier for a learning objective hierarchy. This value is immutable once set during creation.
column.name: LOHIRCHY_ID

table.description: Detailed information about a learning objective category.
table.name: KSLU_LO_CATEGORY

column.description: Unique identifier for a learning objective category record. This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the learning objective category has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description: Date and time that this learning objective category became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this learning objective category expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: Friendly name of the category
column.name: NAME

column.description: Narrative description of the learning objective category
column.name: RT_DESCR_ID

column.description: Unique identifier for a learning objective hierarchy. Once set in creation, this is immutable.
column.name: LOHIRCHY_ID

table.description: Detailed information about a learning objective hierarchy, including the root node.
table.name: KSLU_LO_HIRCHY

column.description: Unique identifier for a learning objective hierarchy.
column.name: ID

column.description: Date and time that this learning objective hierarchy became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this learning objective hierarchy expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: Friendly name of the hierarchy
column.name: NAME

column.description: Narrative description of the learning objective hierarchy
column.name: RT_DESCR_ID

table.description: Information about a learning objective type.
table.name: KSLU_LO_TYPE

column.description: Unique identifier for a learning objective type.
column.name: ID

column.description: Date and time that this learning objective type became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this learning objective type expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: Friendly name of the learning objective type
column.name: NAME

table.description: Information about a learning result type.
table.name: KSLU_LR_TYPE

table.description: Detailed information about a single LUI.
table.name: KSLU_LUI

column.description: Unique identifier for a Learning Unit Instance (LUI). This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the LUI has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description: Unique identifier for an Academic Time Period (ATP).
column.name: ATP_ID

column.description: Date and time that this LUI became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this LUI expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXP_DT

column.description: Code identifier/name for the LUI. This is typically used in human readable form (e.g. ENGL 100 section 123).
column.name: LUI_CODE

column.description: Maximum number of seats that the LUI will hold for registration.
column.name: MAX_SEATS

column.description: The current status of the LUI. The values for this field are constrained to those in the luState enumeration. A separate setup operation does not exist for retrieval of the meta data around this value.
column.name: ST

table.description: Detailed information about a LUI to LUI relationship.
table.name: KSLU_LUILUI_RELTN

column.description: Unique identifier for a LUI to LUI relation. This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the relation has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description: Date and time that this LUI to LUI relationship type became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this LUI to LUI relationship type expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: The current status of the LUI to LUI relationship. The values for this field are constrained to those in the luLuRelationState enumeration. A separate setup operation does not exist for retrieval of the meta data around this value.
column.name: ST

table.description: Information about a LU to LU relationship type.
table.name: KSLU_LULU_RELTN_TYPE

column.description: Unique identifier for the LU to LU relation type.
column.name: ID

column.description: Narrative description of the LU to LU relationship type.
column.name: DESCR

column.description: Date and time that this LU to LU relationship type became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this LU to LU relationship type expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this should be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: Short name of the LU to LU relationship type. This is primarily to be used by developers and may end up translated in the end system.
column.name: NAME

column.description: Description of the reverse of the LU to LU relationship type
column.name: REV_DESC

column.description: Name for the reverse LU to LU relationship type. This is primarily to be used by developers and may end up translated in the end system.
column.name: REV_NAME

table.description: Detailed information about a single learning unit type.
table.name: KSLU_LUTYPE

table.description: Detailed information about learning unit codes.
table.name: KSLU_LU_CODE

column.description: Unique identifier for an LU code record.
column.name: ID

column.description: The description of the code.
column.name: DESCR

column.description: The code value.
column.name: VALUE

table.description: Information about a requirement component.
table.name: KSLU_REQ_COM

column.description: Unique identifier for a requirement component. This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the requirement component has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description: Narrative description of the requirement component.
column.name: DESCR

column.description: Date and time that this requirement component became effective. This is a similar concept to the effective date on enumerated values. When an expiration date has been specified, this field must be less than or equal to the expiration date.
column.name: EFF_DT

column.description: Date and time that this requirement component expires. This is a similar concept to the expiration date on enumerated values. If specified, this must be greater than or equal to the effective date. If this field is not specified, then no expiration date has been currently defined and should automatically be considered greater than the effective date.
column.name: EXPIR_DT

column.description: The current status of the requirement component. The values for this field are constrained to those in the reqComponentState enumeration. A separate setup operation does not exist for retrieval of the meta data around this value.
column.name: ST

table.description: the reqCompFieldTypeInfos
table.name: KSLU_REQ_COM_TYPE

table.description: Detailed information about a single LU statement.
table.name: KSLU_STMT

column.description: Unique identifier for a single LU statement record. This is optional, due to the identifier being set at the time of creation. Once the LU statement has been created, this should be seen as required.
column.name: ID

column.description: Narrative description for the LU statement.
column.name: DESCR

column.description: Friendly name for the LU statement.
column.name: NAME

column.description: Logical operator used to assemble statements. Acceptable values are restricted to AND and OR. This operator applies to both the LU statements and requirement components contained within this statement.
column.name: OPERATOR

column.description: The current status of the LU statement. The values for this field are constrained to those in the luStatementState enumeration. A separate setup operation does not exist for retrieval of the meta data around this value.
column.name: ST
